6/6

While the chart below is still well below 50%, it remains in an uptrend. 

Why not greater than 50%?

He is worth $2 billion, thanks to his wife, Jane Lauder, granddaughter of Est√©e Lauder.

Me on the Schwab Network this morning talking about markets.

Follow-up ...

Trump only TACOs on tariffs if the markets, to use another Trumpism, get "the Yips."

This means he TACOs only if the market tanks and everyone loses a ton of money (like early April).

Without that, sky-high tariffs will remain in place.

Recall that Trump sent out a bunch of letters over the weekend, jacking up Tariffs.

*TRUMP TO IMPOSE 35% TARIFF ON GOODS FROM CANADA
*TRUMP SET TO KEEP TARIFF EXEMPTION FOR USMCA GOODS: US OFFICIAL
*TRUMP SAYS US WILL IMPOSE 30% TARIFFS ON EU, MEXICO FROM AUG. 1

As I write ...

The S&P is down 5 points or down 9 basis points.
The 10-year yield is up less than 1 basis point.
In other words, there is effectively no market reaction to the tariffs,

Trump won. He does not have to TACO. 

Canada, Mexico, and the EU, to quote a Trumpism, don't have any cards to play.

What POTENTIALLY changes this is a giant tariff-driven beat in tomorrow's CPI?

The pain lasted from 2020 to 2023 and is now over. 

As the chart below shows, that was the worst period in 180 years to own bonds. S&P fell 25%.

Getting yields from 0% to 5% was painful (ask Silicon Valley Bank). 

But now that yields are above 4%, this horror show is over.

Google $GOOG said it will spend $25B on AI infrastructure and data centers in the PJM grid region over the next 2 years, and will also spend $3B modernizing two hydropower plants in Pennsylvania to meet growing AI data center power demand.
